page.title: 09Farming.
page.content: There are many farms around Habberley, Stiperstones and Snailbeach and they are all small farms. Usually on hill- farms they only have sheep.They don't have cows because on hills it is not the right pasture for them. The hill farms are mostly rough grazing and sheep are the best kind of animals for rough grazing. The highest useful point for farming is two thousand feet above sea-level.To keep cattle or sheep in they use all kinds of fencing including wire because it's quick to erect, stone walls because they last and hedges because they grow naturally thick and strong. The most popular sheep breeds with the local farmers are Leicesters, Suffolks and mules, which are a black-face and speckle-face Leicester cross. The most popular cattle are Friesians and Hereford cross.
